Package remodel.io

Class TransformWriter

java.lang.Object
remodel.io.AbstractWriter
remodel.io.ExpressionWriter
remodel.io.TransformWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, ExpressionVisitor, TokenCodes
public class TransformWriter
extends ExpressionWriter
TransformWriter is a pretty-printer for ReMoDeL transformations. TransformWriter converts an in-memory parse-tree of a ReMoDeL transformation into its pretty-printed text format. TransformWriter inherits from the pretty-printer ExpressionWriter, which formats code expressions. TransformWriter sends its text output to a buffered ModelStreamer.

TransformWriter implements the Closeable interface (by virtue of inheriting from AbstractWriter), so may be used in try-with-resources blocks, in order to ensure that the TransformWriter and all underlying output streams are closed safely.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Constructor Details

    • TransformWriter

      public TransformWriter​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates a TransformWriter writing to a file, using the default UTF-8 character encoding. Creates a buffering ModelStreamer, writing to the file with the default UTF-8 encoding.
      Parameters:
      file - the output file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened.

    • TransformWriter

      public TransformWriter​(java.io.File file, java.lang.String encoding) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      Creates a TransformWriter writing to a file, using the specified character encoding. Recognised encodings include UTF-8, UTF-16, ISO-8859-1 (Latin-1) and others. Creates a buffering ModelStreamer, writing to the file with the given encoding.
      Parameters:
      file - the output file.
      encoding - the name of the character encoding.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened.
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the character encoding is not supported.

  • Method Details

    • writeModel

      public void writeModel​(Transform transform) throws java.io.IOException
      Serialises the given Transform and streams a textual representation of it to the output. This method is the main entry point for writing a transformation. The Transform argument is the root of a parse-tree. The output model data is in the serial format for ReMoDeL transformations.
      Parameters:
      transform - a Transform.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output streaming fault occurs.
